summary: Add shrines for each of the divine nine to the dining room of Whiterun\'s Breezhome player purchasable house, so you can get your preferred blessing before leaving home!
descriptionHtml:
Wall of Shrines
Add shrines for each of the divine nine to the dining room of Whiterun\'s Breezhome player purchasable house, so you can get your preferred blessing before leaving home!

See the wiki on Blessings: http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Blessings

You can use this to make custom changes for each of your characters, and their homes will stay as you create them even when this mod is no longer needed or running.

This mod is self contained, and does not require an outside script-engine for use.

You do not need Auto-Hotkey to use this mod--simply run the executable file from the download. But, this mod was made by and for Auto-Hotkey, and there is also a standard text-file script for folks who do already use this phenomenally useful utility.

This mod requires a certain ceramic pot from the default furnishings still be present in the Breezehome location. If you have removed the right side pot from the table under the weapon plaque in the loft, then you will need to reset the interior of Breezehome to use this mod. Instructions for this follow the general use instructions.

PLEASE MAKE A NAMED-FILE SAVE OF YOUR GAME BEFORE ATTEMPTING THESE CHANGES. You have been warned, in ALL CAPS!
This script floods commands to the Skyrim console, keystroke by keystroke. It usually works, but can easily get off track, so SAVE A BACKUP FIRST.

Using the Breezhome Shrine-Wall Script for Auto-Hotkey
1. Start the script using either the executable or text-file.
2. In game, enter the Breezehome location.
3. With the console closed (unopened), type the keystroke [Ctrl+Shift+W]
4. Wait for the script to complete, then quicksave and quickload the game to finalize the requested modifications.
5. Exit the running script. You don\'t need it anymore.
	
***
Instructions for resetting the interior of Breezehome

Must Be Done If You Ever Took a Certain Pot Out of the Loft of Breezehome.

This will reset the furniture and items in the home. Some containers are reset too!

Gather all your items into your personal inventory before going outside and making the reset or they may be LOST FOREVER
Again, must be done unless you just now bought the house or are super-double-sure the pot (ID: cb4ab) on the right side of the table under the weapon rack in the upstairs loft still exists.
1) Exit the home. Stand out in the street.
2) Open the console (tilde key) and enter this command line without quotations:
\"resetinterior WhiterunBreezehome\" (hit Enter)
3) Close the console, quicksave and quickload to effect the requested changes
4) Re-enter the house and add your new furniture!
author: Taken
